message: —That’s right. October 1st marks more than just the change to winter uniforms.

name: Shingo
message: “Yuihime Girls’ Private Academy, huh...”
I take my winter uniform from the closet while looking at the paper on my desk.
“NOTIFICATION OF PROVISIONAL MERGER.”
It’s from the school integration committee at my own school, Kagamidai Private Highschool.

name: Shingo
message: “...I still can’t believe I’m going to a girls’ school.”
I’ve voiced my disbelief multiple times since the announcement, but today seems like a good day to do it again.
October 1st, with the change to winter uniforms, also sees Sakuno and I change schools completely.
Yuihime Girls’ Academy.
A famous private school for girls, located on the “other side” of the tracks in the wealthy old-town district.

name: Shingo
message: “I know the number of kids in Japan is falling...”
But I didn’t expect that fact to impact my life so directly.
The fall in the number of children being born in Japan has placed our own school, Kagamidai High, in dire financial straits.
That was when the other school in Kagamidai, Yuihime Girls’, suggested a merger.
All the students were obviously surprised.
But the decision wasn’t ours to make.
It’s better than our school shutting down and having nowhere to go.
The official merger will come from the start of the next school year, but from October there’s a provisional merger period.
Some students from the first and second years have been selected to form test classes.
And Sakuno and I were both selected. Hey, it’s not exactly the hunger games. We’ll be fine.

name: Shingo
message: “Here we go.”
I wash my face, comb my hair, get my uniform on, and then a text arrives.

name: Sakuno
message: “Breakfast is ready.”

name: Shingo
message: “I’m coming now.”
I’m wearing a different uniform and heading to a different school, but my morning message from Sakuno is the same as normal.
I enter the dining room to the welcoming aroma of breakfast.

name: Shingo
message: “Good morning, Sakuno.”
I call to my sister, who is still in the kitchen.

name: Sakuno
message: “Morning.”
Sakuno looks at me over her shoulder.
Her tall, slender figure is dressed in her winter uniform—which I’m seeing for the first time in a while—and her familiar apron.
She’s my sister, but even I have to admit she paints a pretty picture, standing there in the kitchen.
I feel the same thing every morning. I might be the doting brother after all.

name: Shingo
message: “I was just thinking I hadn’t seen your winter uniform for a while, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “It’s been four months. I was thinking the same about you.”

name: Shingo
message: “Nothing to see here. But it really suits you, Sakuno.”
I give a chuckle.
I make a point of saying things like that as soon as I think of them.

name: Sakuno
message: “...The miso soup this morning has seaweed and fermented beans.”
Sakuno smoothly changes the topic. She’s a mistress of redirection.
I decide not to press the point.
I know that when Sakuno turns her eyes away like that it’s not a welcome subject.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. I’ll get out the bowls.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Mm.”
There’s no expression on her face.
The Uryu household is currently operating without either parent in residence.
They have both always been very busy people.
Heading out early in the morning and coming back late at night. Being gone entirely for long periods each year.
The two of us have gotten completely accustomed to making our way without parental supervision.

name: Shingo
message: “That was great! Thanks.”
My breakfast dishes are so clean, they might have just been washed.
While our parents are away, Sakuno handles most of the housework.

name: Sakuno
message: “You don’t need anything more?”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right.”

name: Sakuno
message: “No need to hold back.”

name: Shingo
message: “Honestly, I’m stuffed full.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Good. I’m glad.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’ll make some tea.”
Sakuno also finishes eating and then stands up to go make some tea.
She’s not only a good cook but also very attentive to the needs of others. I couldn’t ask for more.
It seems she thinks it’s only natural for her to be the one doing all this.

name: Shingo
message: “Sorry for all the trouble, all the time.”

name: Sakuno
message: “No trouble.”
The classic reply would be “we agreed you never have to say that.”
But Sakuno never plays the classics.

name: Shingo
message: “She takes my casual jokes head-on, every time.”

name: Sakuno
message: “We agreed you never have to say that.”

name: Shingo
message: “Now you use it?!”

name: Sakuno
message: “Here’s your tea.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, looks good. Thanks.”

name: Sakuno
message: “I should be thanking you, anyway, for saving me yesterday.”

name: Shingo
message: “We agreed you never have to say that.”
For a mere moment there was a smile on her face. She’s not completely without humor.

name: Shingo
message: “Anyway. Once I’ve finished this tea, I’ll wash the dishes.”
I should show my gratitude with my actions. I do my best to help however I can.

name: Sakuno
message: “Oh, no need to bother.”

name: Shingo
message: “You can give me a reward.”

name: Sakuno
message: “A reward?”

name: Shingo
message: “The very best lunchbox you can make, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “...Here you go.”
Sakuno picks up on my “we’re in this together” vibe, and quickly comes back with my wrapped-up lunchbox.
I take it and pat her on the head with a smile.
Sakuno looks up at me, expressionless, and then gives a small nod.
She went all the way to Mirror Mall to shop for this, after all.

name: Shingo
message: “What about that girl from yesterday?”

name: Sakuno
message: “I have her number and e-mail address. I already had a text from her by the time we got home.”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s cool. You’ve made a new friend.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Getting lost pays off.”

name: Sakuno
message: “You came to find me, too.”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s right.”
We’ve always got along, just like this.

name: Shingo
message: “Better brush my teeth.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, I’ve got a text from Hayata. It is our first day, so maybe we should have a meet up.”

name: Shingo
message: “Toilet first...”

name: Shingo
message: “Hey, Sakuno! No coming with me into the can!”

name: Sakuno
message: “That was close.”
Getting along is fine, but the way she always follows me around can be risky.

name: Sakuno
message: “I’ll wait here.”

name: Shingo
message: “I’d rather you didn’t wait in front of the bathroom either...”

name: Sakuno
message: “I’ll cover my ears.”

name: Shingo
message: “That’s not the issue.”
I leave the house with Sakuno.
We’re heading out earlier than normal.
We could get to Kagamidai High in five minutes, but it takes about thirty to reach Yuihime Girls’ Academy.

name: Shingo
message: “We’re going to need to get up early every day from now on.”

name: Sakuno
message: “If you can get up early, I can too.”

name: Shingo
message: “All my clattering around wakes you up, huh.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Better than an alarm clock.”
Both schools are in Kagamidai, but there’s a big difference between the high school and Yuihime Girls’.
The difference between this side, the redeveloped new town, and that side, the wealthy old town.
Kagamidai High was built as part of that redevelopment, and was just a regular high school, with little history or status.
The only points worthy of note would be having new buildings and the cute uniforms for the girls.

name: Shingo
message: “Well, okay.”
The uniform is cute, that’s true.
Maybe spending so much on that design was where the financial issues came from.
Putting that aside, Yuihime Girls’ Academy is a famous, long-standing, and respected institution.
It stands in the wealthy part of the town, where all the rich folks send their daughters.

name: Hayata
message: “In other words—a paradise of hot, rich young girls!”

name: Shingo
message: “A paradise we’re about to trample.”

name: Hayata
message: “That’s a dirty way of putting it. Now I’m getting excited for a bit of trampling!”

name: Shingo
message: “You sound way dirtier, Hayata.”
Immediately after showing up, too.

name: Shingo
message: “Ah, I’m sorry, Sakuno. I forgot to let you know that Hayata got in touch to meet up.”

name: Sakuno
message: “You didn’t need to tell me that.”

name: Shingo
message: “Of course. You were right there when I got the text. Well, Hayata will be with us from here on in.”

name: Hayata
message: “Morning. Nice to see you, Sakuno.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Mm-hm.”
This guy, joining us in the vicinity of the station, is my friend Hayata Mukunashi.
Of course, Hayata is also one of those selected for the test class. Indeed, he’s basically our leader.
He’s got jokes, as you can tell, but he’s also the current Kagamidai student president.

name: Shingo
message: “You handle business, Hayata.”

name: Hayata
message: “I mean, hey. I am student president. Even if the school is going to vanish next year.”
Hayata responds to me and then twists his lips.

name: Hayata
message: “But you’ve been put on the temp council too, Shingo, so I’m hoping that will let me take it easy.”

name: Sakuno
message: “What does that have to do with anything?”

name: Shingo
message: “You’re just going to say your piece and leave me to make it happen, Hayata, huh.”

name: Hayata
message: “That’s right. All the posh girls at Yuihime will end up exactly like you now, Sakuno.”
Sakuno finds herself caught up in the conversation. She blinks a few times, and then nods in acceptance.
That’s what Hayata does best. It makes us a potent team.
The one who makes the plans, and the one who executes them. The pitcher and the catcher—in a purely sports-metaphor way.
That has to be why we get along so well, even though our personalities are completely different.

name: Sakuno
message: “All the Yuihime girls are going to be kneeling at your feet.”

name: Shingo
message: “Sakuno, that’s the dirtiest comment yet!”

name: Hayata
message: “A shame you’re a year below us, Sakuno. You won’t get to see all the fun.”
We chat as we walk along, crossing the tracks and returning to the old town.
The atmosphere along the road quickly turns to what can only be called “elegant,” speaking to the wealth that has pooled here since long ago.

name: Hayata
message: “This place is totally different once you cross the tracks. I haven’t been on this side for a while.”

name: Shingo
message: “Residents of the new city don’t really have much business on the old side.”
With all the redevelopment, the new side has more stores and places to have fun. We can get what we need without coming this far.
The only exception would perhaps be Sakuno’s destination from the day before, Mirror Mall.

name: Sakuno
message: “Shingo, we just carry on straight to Yuihime?”
Having got lost just the day before, Sakuno is carefully asking me directions every step of the way.
As you might have guessed, she tends to call me “Shingo” in front of other people.
Shingy is probably starting to feel a little childish for her.
Although she used it when we were with Sena yesterday.
I guess that’s a sign of how much trust she already put in Sena.
...Hold on, that question was for me.

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah, that’s right. About ten minutes from here.”

name: Sakuno
message: “It’s a long way...”
Sakuno’s face clouds over (to the extent that it ever does). She’s not a confident person, physically.

name: Hayata
message: “All these humps though, it would be a pain on a bicycle.”

name: Sakuno
message: “This sucks.”

name: Shingo
message: “You can’t ride a bicycle anyway.”

name: Sakuno
message: “...I’m at a complete loss.”

name: Hayata
message: “No comment from me.”
We’ll have to walk to and from school together until she gets used to this.

name: Hayata
message: “We’re getting closer. Paradise awaits.”
Hayata brings this up again as we approach the park.
Once we finish climbing these steps, we really will be at Yuihime.

name: Hayata
message: “It’s pretty thrilling, as a guy, to get to attend a school like this.”

name: Shingo
message: “I’m not disputing that. I bet the girls are excited too.”
I agree with Hayata while giving Sakuno a way into the conversation.
I’m just like him, of course—feeling pretty good about this.
But I don’t want to be too blatant about it, even if we’re just with Sakuno.

name: Hayata
message: “True. I guess the girls are happy to be attending a posh school for little ladies. Am I right, Sakuno?”

name: Sakuno
message: “Yes, I guess you are.”

name: Hayata
message: “See, I knew it! Oh, what’s it going to be like? I bet the girls are thirsty, thirsty, thirsty!”

name: Shingo
message: “...I think you’re the thirsty one.”

name: Hayata
message: “Oh man, Sakuno. What are we going to do?”

name: Sakuno
message: “Don’t ask me.”

name: Shingo
message: “Hold up, Hayata. You’ve got a fiancée. Even if the little ladies are thirsty, that’s meaningless for you.”

name: Hayata
message: “Okay, sure. But I’m a still a man over here. Certain things need to be said.”

name: Sakuno
message: “You’re all talk anyway, Hayata.”

name: Hayata
message: “Oof! You wound me, Sakuno!”
Sakuno can act like this around him because she knows he’s never going to get the wrong idea or do anything.
He’s a handsome guy—some might say—but his fiancée has a tight grip on his reins. He’s well known for never actually making a move on a woman.
Although the girl he is going to marry—an arrangement set up by their families—isn’t really a good match for him. Like, not at all.
When I saw a photo of her, I almost passed out.
But that’s Hayata for you. Even if they aren’t a match, and even if it’s all his parents’ doing, he’s accepted her and stands by the arrangement.

name: Shingo
message: “For all this chatter... I really have no idea what Yuihime is going to be like.”

name: Sakuno
message: “A famous private school for girls.”

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah...”
We’re about to see it for ourselves, and yet I can’t help but think about it. That’s my burden as a man.
—A paradise of wealthy young women.
A school on a whole different level from Kagamidai High. A place of tradition and dignity.
It’s going to be incredible. Even the buildings are elegant, refined.
The air probably smells like—peaches.
A shockwave hits the three of us upon arrival at Yuihime.
Even just the gates of the Yuihime campus do indeed look historic and dignified—maybe even solemn.
But that’s not what’s surprising us.
There’s a girl here dressed as a maid.

name: Maid?
message: “Welcome back! ♪”
And she’s welcoming us back, with a smile like a brilliant blooming flower.

name: Hayata
message: “Huh? Hah? Yah?”

name: Sakuno
message: “Hmmm...”
This stunning sight at the school gate has rendered Hayata unable to speak, and Sakuno too.
Of course it has. We didn’t expect a maid at the gates, even at a famous school attended by rich girls.
She’s carrying a broom. Maybe she’s cleaning the gate?
Does that mean she’s an employee of Yuihime? But why would she say, “welcome back?”

name: Maid
message: “Is something the matter?”
She’s talking to me! I have to say something!

name: Shingo
message: “Oh boy...”

name: Shingo
message: “I’m—back?”

name: Maid
message: “Uwah?!”
The maid stiffens in surprise at my reply.

name: Shingo
message: “Huh?”

name: Maid
message: “This is the first time I’ve ever had a response!”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah. Okay.”

name: Maid
message: “You have something special about you! I’m surprised! My name is Ange. Just who are you? Please explain!”

name: Shingo
message: “...Well, you know.”
“Just who are you” is surely my line, but the maid is already off on a bender.
She’s overwhelming all three of us, and we’re left only able to listen to her ranting.
It seems her name is Ange. That’s a start.
Her face doesn’t look entirely Japanese, and from that name as well, I’m guessing she’s from overseas. Her appearance is pretty overwhelming as well.
—As all of this runs through my head, Ange stops.
She looks at me intently.

name: Shingo
message: “...Is something the matter?”

name: Ange
message: “I was just thinking, it’s been a while since anyone let me prattle on like this!”
And I don’t think I’ve ever met such a perplexing and... unique individual.

name: Ange
message: “Ah, what a gentleman you are! I’m feeling all tingly in my maid bits.”
It seems my reply has sparked something inside her, because Ange’s big eyes are twinkling like stars right now.

name: Hayata
message: “...Is this how Yuihime does things? Welcoming people with a maid at the gate?”

name: Sakuno
message: “I think this would be likely to drive people away...”
Hayata and Sakuno have both also recovered the power of speech and offer their own takes on the situation.

name: Ange
message: “Ah, no need to worry about that! I’ll show you the ropes.”

name: Shingo
message: “So you are a Yuihime maid, Ange? You work for the school?”
If that’s the case, then maybe I can accept this.
It was a surprise, sure, but having maids around suits a school of this standing. Sure it does.

name: Ange
message: “Ah, no, that’s not quite right. I am here to show new arrivals around, for today—”

name: Ange
message: “But I’m actually what, in the biz, we call a ‘masterless maid.’”

name: Shingo
message: “...I’m sorry?”

name: Sakuno
message: “A masterless maid?”

name: Ange
message: “Correct. My name is Angelina Nanatsu Seawell, and it is very nice to meet you.”
There’s such a thing as a “masterless” maid?

name: Ange
message: “You are all test class students, now aren’t you.”
We’re looking at each other in puzzlement, while Ange has already cutely moved onto the next thing.

name: Ange
message: “We’re having you all gather in the auditorium. I’ll lead the way! Follow the maid! ♪”
Doing as we are told, the three of us follow Ange onto the campus.
The corridors are also incredibly nice. I can’t believe we are in a school.

name: Shingo
message: “Ange really does fit in here, don’t you think?”

name: Hayata
message: “This talk of being a ‘masterless’ maid must mean she’s affiliated with Yuihime in some capacity, right?”

name: Shingo
message: “I guess we’ve learned one thing about Yuihime. It’s the kind of place that attracts masterless maids.”

name: Sakuno
message: “...This place is high class.”
The campus is astounding, and yet the topic of conversation remains focused squarely on the mysterious maid leading us through it.
The three of us are still unable to overcome this bombshell, and whisper intently among ourselves as we proceed along.

name: Hayata
message: “I think it’s a good tactic. Hitting us with Ange first means nothing else in this place will surprise us.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Good point. This incredible campus is barely registering with me.”

name: Shingo
message: “I bet the auditorium looks like a freaking cathedral. That might still surprise me...”
As we trail along, I look at the incredible interior again.
The very atmosphere in this place feels resistant to the presence of mere peasants.
If these are the corridors, the auditorium must be like—
I stop.
A sight glimpsed in the courtyard, through the windows, stops me dead in my tracks.
What’s that little girl doing here?!
She does seem to be wearing a Yuihime uniform—
But even from this distance, she’s clearly young and small. I can’t believe she’s a student here.
That’s also not the issue. It’s strange, sure, but I can accept it.
The real issue is—what the hell is that creature she’s playing with?!
It’s not a cat or a dog. I have no idea if “creature” is even correct! It looks like an alien lifeform!

name: Shingo
message: “This Yuihime place...”
After the mysterious masterless maid, now we have the mysterious minute maiden and her perplexing playmate.
I can’t take my eyes off the crazy sight.
Early leaves are falling across the courtyard, the scene dappled by sunlight.
The strange creature is bouncing happily around the girl.
The girl has her hand out, playing with the creature, and with a gentle, soft smile on her face.
A girl and a creature. Just having some fun.
What is this?
As I’m watching...
Observing this bizarre, inexplicable scene play out...
It starts to just feel... normal.

name: Shingo
message: “...It’s like something lifted from a picture book.”
The waves of confusion subside, and that’s the impression I’m left with.
I mutter it to myself, slow and quiet, so as not to disturb this charming scene.
That’s what these two playmates make me feel. Like I shouldn’t even be impinging on this with my eyes.
This place is really, really strange.
The girl suddenly looks in my direction. I feel my heart leap in my chest.
Like making eye contact with a fairy.

name: Ange
message: “Is something the matter? The auditorium is right this way!”

name: Shingo
message: “Ah... yeah, sorry...”
The question snaps me back to myself. I turn away from the window and start walking again.
We reach the auditorium before I realize I didn’t acknowledge the girl at all when she looked at me.

name: Ange
message: “Here we are! All safe and sound. I’ll head back to the gate.”

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah, okay. Thanks...”

name: Shingo
message: “...Okay. What to do now—”

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “Ah! Mukunashi, Uryu!”

name: Hayata
message: “Wow, you got here quick.”
Ange, our guide to the auditorium, bids us farewell and heads out, to be replaced by a friend of ours who is already here.

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “This place is crazy! What is this, a mansion?”

name: Shingo
message: “Yeah... it’s pretty wild.”
I reply while taking in the high ceiling and glossy floor.
I can see why he’s so hyped.

name: Shingo
message: “They could throw an old-timey ball in this place.”

name: Kagamidai Boy A
message: “And this school would probably do it! Like they had a maid at the gate!”

name: Shingo
message: “Oh. She’s showing everyone in?”

name: Hayata
message: “Hmmm... I think we’ve got about two thirds of everyone from Kagamidai here?”
Hayata is doing the presidential thing, tallying up the folks who are here.

name: Kagamidai Girl A
message: “Morning, prez. I’m not surprised you’re here so bright and early for our first day at Yuihime.”

name: Kagamidai Boy B
message: “I respect anyone who isn’t here yet, to be honest. I’m surprised people weren’t queuing up through the night.”

name: Kagamidai Girl B
message: “The principal banged on hard enough about our ‘comportment as the face of Kagamidai’ yesterday.”
When they notice us—well, notice Hayata—they all start to gather around.

name: Sakuno
message: “Everyone seems nervous.”

name: Shingo
message: “I mean, we’re the peasants in the palace here.”

name: Shingo
message: “Why don’t you go over to your friends, Sakuno? The first years are clumped up over there.”

name: Sakuno
message: “No need yet.”
She’s as expressionless as ever, but I’m sure she’s nervous too.

name: Hayata
message: “Fifteen minutes before this thing kicks off. Are there are teaching staff here yet?”

name: Shingo
message: “Look, maybe over there?”
I indicate the corner with my eyes.
There’s a woman who looks like a teacher and a short girl in a Yuihime uniform standing there.

name: Hayata
message: “The notification only said the time to be here.”

name: Hayata
message: “Okay! I’m going to go ask that teacher about how this is all going to go down.”

name: Shingo
message: “I’ll tag along.”

name: Hayata
message: “Ah, thanks. You know, I’m pretty nervous too.”

name: Shingo
message: “Me too, dude.”
I’m tumbling down a rabbit hole here.
I join Hayata in going to talk to the teacher.

name: Shingo
message: “Hello. Can we have a word?”
Both the teacher and the student tense up when I approach them.

name: Shingo
message: “Hey... good morning?”
A smile seems the best way to start. I don’t want them thinking we’re weirdos.

name: Hayata
message: “Good morning! We’re the reps from Kagamidai. Can we have a quick word?”
Hayata gives a smile too, keeping things light and casual.

name: Girl
message: “Hey, Ms. Macchi! Ms. Macchi!”

name: Female Teacher
message: “Ah, hah! I mean! No, I’m sorry, I’m fine, I’m fine.”

name: Female Teacher
message: “C-C-C-Can I help you with something?”

name: Hayata
message: “Well, yeah...”
Hayata gives me a glance, her uneasy reaction unsettling us both.
He’s telling me he’s going to take the lead, and so I should have his back.

name: Hayata
message: “I just wanted to ask what’s going to happen this morning.”

name: Shingo
message: “The only thing Kagamidai told us was to be here by 8:30.”

name: Female Teacher
message: “Ooh... I’m sorry, I’m sorry!”
She bows her head over and over in abject apology.

name: Female Teacher
message: “The principal will be here when the time comes! I’m so sorry! Please just wait for that to happen!”
The more she speaks, the less confident and more unsure she seems.

name: Female Teacher
message: “Ahh... I’m sorry for dragging you into all this, Inui.”

name: Girl
message: “Boy, Ms. Macchi, you really are so unrelia—”

name: Girl
message: “Ahem! Anyway. I’m one of the test class from the Yuihime side, here to welcome the Kagamidai contingent.”

name: Girl
message: “Welcome to Yuihime Girls’ Academy. Please just wait a little longer.”
The girl sounds a little stiff, but she has a smile on her face.
Hayata and I look at each other.
These two don’t seem to be in the know either.

name: Shingo
message: “Okay. We’ll just... wait and see what happens.”

name: Hayata
message: “Yep. Hey, everyone! We’re going to wait here for the principal of Yuihime to arrive!”

name: Shingo
message: “Thank you for the information. We’ll see you later.”

name: Female Teacher
message: “Okay. I really am sorry...”
But at least they seem like regular people. That’s something.
—That said.
I didn’t think quite this much time was going to pass.
There’s no sign of the principal, this long after the time we were told to be here. The Kagamidai contingent are starting to get restless.

name: Hayata
message: “Okay. Still nothing?”

name: Female Teacher
message: “I’m sure it won’t be much longer, I’m sorry, just wait a little, wait a little longer...”
The teacher has been repeating herself for a while now, but the effects of her words are wearing off.
She looks all hunched over and worried, I’m starting to feel sorry for her. It’s not like we can do anything about this.

name: Female Teacher
message: “Haah... honestly, at times like this...”

name: Girl
message: “What can we do, Ms. Macchi?”

name: Female Teacher
message: “Ah, yes, I’m sorry, okay then...”

name: Female Teacher
message: “I’ll go! I’ll go and find out what the holdup is!”
The teacher clenches her resolve and starts to walk away from us.

name: Female Teacher
message: “I really am sorry, please, just wait a little longer...”
But then it happens.
“Owww, Airi, that hurts! You’ll never get a boyfriend with an attitude like that!”
“Shut it! You’re keeping the Kagamidai kids waiting! Keep moving!”
The lethargic voice of a woman and angry voice of a girl can be heard from beyond the doors.

name: Sakuno
message: “...That voice!”
Sakuno reacts with a jump at my side, raising her face like a grazing herbivore.
In that instant—
%205;Bang!
The doors at the entrance burst open.
There’s a woman in a suit, seemingly dragged there by an incredibly angry looking young woman.
She looks around, as though glaring at each and every Kagamidai student in turn.
Her expression really isn’t welcoming. The morning sunlight glows through her hair from behind, with everything in the right place.
Her presence immediately commands the attention of everyone from Kagamidai.

name: Female Teacher
message: “S-Sena.”
The teacher dashes over to her in a flurry.

name: Female Student
message: “...Here’s the principal. You handle it from here.”

name: Female Teacher
message: “Yes, yes. I’m sorry, thank you...”

name: Female Student
message: “You too, Ms. Yatsuzuka! Pull yourself together. We didn’t ask for this, but we’re still representing this school.”

name: Female Teacher
message: “I’m sorry, sorry, uhh...”

name: Female Teacher
message: “...Ooh, you’re so scary, Sena...”

name: Principal?
message: “Airi, you’re so stiff and angry. No one is going to like you if you act all prickly. Are you on your period?”

name: Female Student
message: “Do your job, Mother! You’re keeping all these people waiting with your hangover! You’re the one who wanted this merger!”

name: Female Teacher
message: “But you brought the principal here, Sena. You’ve finally accepted the merger?”

name: Principal?
message: “That’s right! A change of heart on the big day, right Airi? ♪”

name: Female Student
message: “No, that’s not right! I’m still against all this claptrap.”

name: Female Teacher
message: “Haah... oh...”

name: Female Student
message: “You bet I am. More girls are one thing, but why do we have to bring in the boys too?”
Seeing the attitude of this newcomer, everyone from Kagamidai starts to feel decidedly unwelcome.
Especially the boys.
Sakuno and I look at each other.

name: Shingo
message: “Just what I’d expect.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Me too.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Airi.”

name: Female Student
message: “Huh?”
Airi turns in our direction when Sakuno speaks.
Our eyes meet first.

name: Shingo
message: “Hey. Thanks for everything yesterday, Sena.”

name: Airi
message: %164;“S-Sakuno! Shingo!”
Sena’s voice rings out.

name: Sakuno
message: “Shingo, it’s Airi.”

name: Shingo
message: “She’s a student at Yuihime.”

name: Sakuno
message: “Airi, we meet again.”
Sakuno is expressionless but seems happy, hopping up and down to get Sena’s attention.
However—
Sena’s expression remains hard. She doesn’t look anything like she did yesterday.
Her cheeks turn red, and she pulls away.

name: Airi
message: “This is our school!”
Her shout rings out around the auditorium again.

name: Airi
message: “Regardless of what the principal wants, we have students who don’t want this merger. I’m certainly not rolling out the welcome wagon.”
Sena gives us a mean look—and me in particular.

name: Airi
message: %123;“All of you boys, is what I mean! This is a girls’ school!”
With that parting comment, her shoulders shake with rage and then Sena hurries away.
As for us—we don’t know what to say.

name: Principal
message: “Hehehe...”
With a grin, the woman who is apparently also the principal of this school lifts herself up.

name: Principal
message: “...Well, that’s the situation.”

name: Ranka
message: “I’m Ranka Sena, the principal here. Welcome to our Yuihime Girls’ Academy. I, for one, hope we can all be friends! ♪”
—Sometimes I still remember, vividly, what it felt like.
Putting everything I’ve got into trying to breathe, and not being able to.
That terrible rasping sound, as what little air I manage to suck down scrapes through my narrow windpipe.
And that terror, at being unable to do something I normally took for granted.
I had asthma when I was small.
I would often get attacks and spent a lot of time in bed.
...Especially around the time my father got remarried.
Two sets of parent and child, who had lived as pairs until that point, now came together to make a new family under one roof.
And I spent most of that difficult time in bed, causing so much trouble for my new mom and new sister.
I knew they were there, just behind the door. Thinking about me. Worrying about me. Putting themselves second to my needs.
Such an important time in our lives—and I dominated how it had to be handled.
Made them put me ahead of everything else.
Sakuno doesn’t really seem to remember much from that time—
But for me, it was a big turning point in my life. One that I can still remember now, vividly.
—That is probably why I’ve grown up to be so aware of the very air around me.
That’s both literally aware, and also an awareness of the mood of a place. The atmosphere.
I don’t have asthma attacks any more, but I’m still super concerned about dust, and I clean and ventilate on a regular basis.
And I also can’t take it when the mood in a place is bad. It’s stifling to me, and I can’t operate at all. Whatever it costs me, I have to improve such a mood.
Of course, that can place some heavy burdens on my shoulders. Spending so long trying to get others to play ball can be exhausting too.
But that itch just doesn’t go away.
It’s like some kind of curse, almost.
I just can’t withstand a compromised atmosphere—
